    Looking back at 2019’s “Next Career Move”

    1 minute read

    2019 was quite a year, I would say. I ran X amount of miles, I traveled to London, Boston, and Japan. I fortiously got the simileanous experiences of startup movement I yearned most, meanwhile being at a corporate role. And most importantly, I became more at peace with myself.

    “I was near my deadline to finding a full-time role, and considered going back to being a TCV–but they wanted to continue next steps into interviewing…”

    In this article, I want to review 3 things that I am truly blessed to have, after having to endure trials and learnings since the past 3 years coming to San Francisco, seen here.

    • Traveling

    • Landing a Full-time job as a Data Professional

    • The 2020 Vision: Next Steps

    Traveling

    My first time traveling outside of California was in 2018, going to Hawaii with a special someone. This was a surreal experience, as I had my first takeoff into a immersed world, only what felt like a combination of being distant from a world, and feeling a sense of isolation from it all- Heck, now I know why Sora from Kingdom Hearts was looking into the ocean, feeling what was out there.

    Anyways, I wanted 2019 to be different–my girlfriend pushed me to go to the #1 place I always wanted to be in, London UK. Always talking about the culture, diversity in music, arts, and more I was interested in the country. Super happy she made me go then, and this was a celebration therafter I took my leap of faith into finding a full time role. Looking back…It was great to have a calm before the storm of dissapointed, self reflection,and beatened conficdence in—the job search.

    Landing a Full-time job as a Data Professional
